text.text_translated: Julie Wong is a top researcher in the area of Robotics and AI. She has written more than 50 scientific articles, sometimes alone and sometimes with other people. Her work is in very important science magazines that are checked by other experts. She often speaks at meetings with scientists from all over the world. In 2012, she won a very special award called the Royal Academy Simone Fielding fellowship. An academy is an important organization for experts. A fellowship is a prize of money that helps a researcher do their work. Julie lives with her family in a smart home that she designed herself.

feedback.feedback: PASS. The text adheres perfectly to B1 standards. Complex concepts like 'peer-reviewed' and 'co-author' are simplified into clear B1 language. The C1 word 'academy' and the key term 'fellowship' are correctly identified and defined in simple terms. All facts are accurate. No errors.
